content.p: Instrumentation Laboratory (IL) is a global leader in the manufacturing, and distribution of medical devices and testing technologies. IL depends on data analytics for growth and success. The company needs to enable its research and development (R&D) engineers to access and analyze test data to support their customers in California, New York, and Barcelona, Spain. The company needs to access data quickly and perform complex analyses accurately and consistently. The company needs an analytics platform that R&D engineers can use to troubleshoot problems, monitor test data, and create automated alerts to identify emerging issues. The business team stated that the proposed solution must have adequate statistical functionality and considerations for securing health care data.

Instrumentation Laboratory "shopped around" and found two possible solutions (Solutions A and B) that would meet their analytic objectives. IL’s lead data scientist assessed both tools using pre-defined metrics set by its business leadership and data analytics team. IL has chosen Solution A for implementation. This solution allows IL to build the needed analysis configurations on top of the company’s data for enterprise wide analysis. Solution A will be easier to deploy and integrate with existing systems within the company.

Some of the benefits of this solution include: creating standardized analysis configurations that can be used across the enterprise to ensure quality and consistency. The tool will be used to support supply chain monitoring for their medical device manufacturing processes. Due to the automated alerts, R&D engineers can focus on other tasks without missing issues related to testing and medical devices. Using this scenario above, answer questions 1-3 :

body.p: Which statement below can be described as an analytic objective for this project?

input.choice: The company needs to enable its research and development (R&D) engineers to access and analyze test data to support its efforts in California, New York, and Barcelona, Spain.
The company needs to access data quickly and perform complex analyses accurately and consistently.
The company needs a platform that would enable its R&D engineers to troubleshoot problems, monitor test data, and receive alerts that highlight product and process issues that require attention.
The company needs to build defined analysis configurations using predictive modeling on top of the company’s data to enable enterprise wide analytics.

feedback.p: Incorrect: This is a business need.
Incorrect: This is a business need.
Incorrect: This is a business objective.
Correct: This statement represents an analytic objective that has method, data and functionality defined.

body.p: During the requirements gathering process for the IL project, your team is determining the operational requirements related to the solution. Which pairing is an example of a requirement that should be considered:

feedback.p: Incorrect: Usability is an operational requirement, while transaction handling is a functional requirement.
Correct: Usability and performance are operational requirements that consider user and performance capabilities.
Incorrect: Performance is an operational requirement, while transaction handling is a functional requirement.
Incorrect: Performance is an operational requirement, while Authentication is a functional requirement.

body.p: An outside consultant was hired to collect information from IL's Business Leaders, R&D Engineers, and Client Success Managers. The consultant conducted an interactive session to help define the vision of the project and gather business requirements. This requirements gathering technique is known as a(an):

feedback.p: Incorrect: This is an idea gathering session involving a small group of stakeholders.
Correct! This interactive workshop involves a neutral facilitator and a cross section of stakeholders to define the mission and vision of a project and to gather business or product requirements.
Incorrect: This is a one or one or small group exercise that involves asking participants questions about their needs.
Incorrect: Observations are a great way for the business analyst to see how users interact with the current system and how the system functions.

body.p: An analytic objective effectively posits that a task and method improves a clearly defined metric with regard to a business problem. This is also considered a:

feedback.p: Correct: An analytic objective can also be seen as a research hypothesis. They serve the same purpose in a data science project.
Incorrect: You can consider a data science project as a research study in certain contexts. A research study uses an empirical framework to understand a problem.
Incorrect: This is a synthesis of key points of a project or study.
Incorrect: A research method describes the techniques for analyzing and collecting data.

body.p: A successful data science project must have well defined analytic objectives. Reference steps I-IV and select the option that has the right ordering for formulating analytic objectives:
I)Once the business objective is stated, the data science team will propose a solution vision describing how the company will reach the objective.
II) The data science team will engage with the company to learn about its clients, market and competitors.
III) The data science team will propose a method and ensure that it can produce the appropriate insight considering the data that is available.
IV) The data science team will characterize the nature of the task to explain how the project will be implemented, and how metrics will be evaluated.

feedback.p: Correct: This is the right order.
Incorrect: Tempting to select but this order would mean that you propose a solution vision prior to learning about the business.
Incorrect: You have skipped the most important part of setting an analytic objective...getting the know your client!
Incorrect: If a data science team follows this route, they will miss out on defining their methods and the type of insight that will meet the business objective.

body.p: Consider a data science project that involves the development of an interactive sales dashboard including data from the sales database.Your client has stated that the dashboard must be available to business leadership and middle managers during business hours from Monday to Friday and from 10am to 2pm EST on Sundays. The business analyst has defined and included this requirement in the requirements management plan document. What type of requirement is this:

feedback.p: Incorrect: Functional requirements for this scenario might include a user's ability to export content from the dashboard or the update functionality such as a user's ability to manually import data.
Correct! This is an availability requirement that informs the developers about when the dashboards should be running and updated.
Incorrect: We can easily assume that the data/results fed into the dashboard are as a result of a model but availability considerations are availability requirements.

Incorrect: The dashboard contains data as defined during the data requirements gathering process but this requirement is focused on the availability of the tool and not the data presented through the tool.

body.p: A company is seeking an analytical solution to increase customer sales. Once the company has identified current sources of data to support the analytical solution, it is considered:

feedback.p: Correct!
Incorrect: A preliminary analysis of the available data has not been conducted to ensure it supports the analytic objectives.
Incorrect: The company has not determined how to incorporate AI into its workflows.
Incorrect: The company has not deployed its analytic solution!

body.p: Once a project team has identified the problem for which data should be leveraged, the next step in defining the project's analytic objective is to:

input.choice: Characterize the problem into one or more data science tasks.
Test the explainability of two or more models to determine their usefulness to the problem.
Reframe the focus of the identified problem to determine whether it is providing a specific insight or resource to the business.
Engage with the client and research about the specific circumstances of the business.

feedback.p: Correct: once a problem has been defined , the team will facilitate effective communication about what the project will implement, and how it will be evaluated along which metrics. This can be done by defining the appropriate data science task.
Incorrect: You can test the explainability of a model's predictions when proposing a learning method.
Incorrect: This is an important step that should be done after proposing your learning methods.
Incorrect: You should research about the specific circumstances of the business before identifying the problem.

body.p: Business rules, user and system authorization levels, and authentication considerations are:

feedback.p: Correct!!
Incorrect: operational requirements are also considered non functional requirements.
Incorrect: performance measures are considered non functional requirements and they describe the characteristics of the system.
Incorrect: Analytic requirements describe the characteristics of your methods and data.

body.p: Which team member plays a key role in gathering business requirements?

feedback.p: Correct: The business analyst will lead the requirements gathering and documentation process.
Incorrect: The data analyst is concerned with visualizing data and highlighting insights gleaned from the data.
Incorrect: An ML engineer will automate functions gathered from the analytic requirements.
Incorrect: The data scientist should research the business environment and field but they will not lead gathering business requirements.
